subject: RE: [junit] Linkage Error
msgSnippet: You need to set the fork flag to yes as it s a problem with where Ant is load the XML classes from for the reporter, and where your code under test is
messageBody:
You need to set the fork flag to "yes" as it's a problem with where Ant
is load the XML classes from for the reporter, and where your code under
test is loading the XML classes from.

They both want the same classes but they come from different places and
so Ant/Junit gets confused.
One reason but the solution given isn't relevant is given in the Junit
FAQ http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_9

At least this is how I see the issue.

The issue that forking has is that the forking of a new VM for each
testcase really slows things down.
I'm thinking of having two test targets, one that forks Junit's standard
textrunner for the normal compile->test->refactor routine (with no
VM-forking), and one forking the VM when I want the XML reporting part
(nightly build, release build, etc.).

Anyone else have a better solution?

Andy.

--
Andrew Beacock
Lammtara

> can any one help me out this.
> -SVSekhar
